content:
• Thursday, February 8, 2018
  • NWL

    WSJ: Starboard to launch proxy fight to replace entire Newell Brands board

    • Newell Brands (NASDAQ:NWL) +4.2% after-hours following a WSJ report that activist investor Starboard Value will launch a proxy fight that seeks to replace CEO Michael Polk and the entire board.
    • Starboard and its allies, who hold a stake of just under 5% in NWL, is aligning with three former executives of Jarden Corp., which NWL bought in 2016, in a bid to take control of the company, according to the report.
    • The group reportedly wants to install former Jarden CEO Jim Lillie as CEO at NWL and former Jarden chairman Martin Franklin, who recently resigned his seat on NWL's board, as NWL's chairman.
    • NWL, whose shares have dropped 40% over the past year, announced two week ago that it would sell some brands and half its factories in an attempt to improve profitability.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 PM | 18 Comments
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate down in late trade despite Q3 revenue beat

    • Lions Gate is lower in postmarket trading -- LGF.A -5.2%, LGF.B -1.3% -- despite revenue that grew more than 50% (with the help of Starz) and beat consensus expectations in its Q3 earnings.
    • Net income of $193M included a one-time tax benefit of $165M due to changes to deferred tax liabilities from new tax legislation; adjusted net income was $107M.
    • Operating income came to $80M, and adjusted OIBDA to $178M. Backlog was $1.2B at year's end.
    • It said it would resume a quarterly cash dividend of $0.09/share.
    • Revenues by segment (Y/Y comparisons pro forma): Media Networks, $382.9M (up 6%); Motion Picture, $539.1M (up 14%); Television Production, $227.3M (down 1.6%).
    • Free cash flow was $140M.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 PM | 3 Comments
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile +3.8% as revenue grows 73%

    • Glu Mobile (NASDAQ:GLUU) is up 3.8% in after-hours trading following Q4 earnings where revenue jumped 73% and beat expectations.
    • Bookings were up 44% to $83.2M, capping off a record year of $320.4M in bookings.
    • Net loss widened to $39.6M from $17.2M.
    • "While much work remains, we made significant progress in transforming the company to a creative, product driven mobile game developer that generates more consistent and improved operating and financial results," says CEO Nick Earl.
    • “We expect sustained, growing adjusted EBITDA profitability Q/Q throughout 2018 with significant growth in absolute dollars from the first half of the year to the second half," says COO/CFO Eric Ludwig. "As such, we expect to achieve meaningful adjusted EBITDA profitability and to generate positive free cash flow in 2018.”
    • Cash and equivalents dropped to $63.8M from $102.1M.
    • For Q1, it's guiding to bookings of $72M-$74M; for the full year, it's forecasting $325M-$335M.
    • In an update earlier today on its work with Disney, the company said it was working on free-to-play mobile gaming that would use characters and stories from across the Disney and Pixar franchises.
    • Earnings call slides
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 PM | 20 Comments
  • Z

    Zillow Group slides amid downbeat Q1 guidance

    • Zillow (Z -9.4%, ZG -7.3%) has tumbled on heavy postmarket volume after its Q4 report featured downside guidance for the current quarter despite beating revenue expectations with a record total in Q4.
    • Of revenues that rose 24% to $282M, Marketplace revenue increased 26% (Premier Agent Revenue was up 21% to $199.5M; Other real estate revenue rose 60% to $47.6M, and Mortgages revenue rose 12% to $18.5M).
    • Display revenue fell 1% to $16.7M, though the company is focusing on Marketplace revenue over display ads.
    • EBITDA came to $70.9M, up from $54.7M a year ago.
    • More than 151M average monthly unique users to company-branded mobile apps and websites (up 8%); visits to apps and websites were up 21% to more than 1.4B.
    • For the quarter ending in March, it's guiding to revenue of $291M-$296M, below consensus for $298M and EBITDA of $42M-$47M (below $69.2M expected). For the full year, it's forecasting revenue of $1.302B-$1.317B (above an expected $1.292B) and EBITDA of $300M-$315M (below an expected $317M).
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • UIS

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (2/8/2018)

    • Top gainers: UIS +16.8%. FEYE +12.1%. NVDA +11.5%. MOBL +8.8%. SKX +7.1%.

    | 5:36 PM | 6 Comments
  • NUAN

    Nuance Communications +3.3% as it returns to organic growth

    • Nuance Communications (NASDAQ:NUAN) is up 3.3% after hours following its Q1 beat marked by a return to organic growth.
    • Strong product sales keyed a revenue gain of 2.6%; a 1% gain on an organic basis. Recurring revenue was 71% of the total, vs. a year-ago 73%.
    • Net new bookings rose 10% to $418.4M, with strong performance showing up in Automotive and the Enterprise division.
    • Net income rose to $80.7M from $76.9M; operating margin was 24.5%, down from the prior year's 26.9%.
    • Revenue breakout: Professional services and hosting, $259M (up 2.2%); Product and licensing, $161.8M (up 6.6%); Maintenance and support, $80.8M (down 2%).
    • It's guiding to annual net new bookings growth of 5-7% and is raising guidance for 2018 organic revenue growth to 3-5% from a previous 2-4%.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • SWIR

    Sierra Wireless beats in Q4 with broad revenue growth

    • Sierra Wireless (NASDAQ:SWIR) is down 3% in thin postmarket trading after beating on top and bottom lines in its Q4 report.
    • The company saw revenue gains across all services, with heaviest growth coming in the higher-margin areas. IoT Services got a boost from the company's acquisition of Numerex.
    • Net earnings came to $9.2M, up from a prior-year $8.8M.
    • EBITDA was $13.9M, down from the prior-year $15.5M but beating an expected $13.8M.
    • Revenue by segment: OEM Solutions, $139.8M (up 3.4%); Enterprise Solutions, $31.8M (up 52%); IoT Services, $11.9M (up 73.5%).
    • For Q1, it's guiding to revenue of $181M-$189M (above consensus for $177.6M) and EPS of $0.04-$0.10 (below consensus for $0.20); it expects Q1 to be impacted by mainly nonrecurring items.
    • Conference call with live slides to come at 5:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM | 21 Comments
  • NVDA

    Nvidia +11.5% on 34% revenue growth, upside guidance, gaming and data demand

    • Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) shares are up 11.5% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with revenue up 34% on the year. 
    • Q1 guidance: Revenue, $2.84B to $2.96B (consensus: $2.47B); EPS, $1.59 to $1.72 (may not be compatible with consensus of $1.13); non-GAAP gross margin, 63% +/- 50 bps; operating expenses, $643M; tax rate, 12%.
    • Segment revenue: GPU, $2.46B (+33%); Tegra Processor, $450M (+75%). 
    • Revenue by market platform: Gaming, $1.74B (+29% Y/Y); Professional Visualization, $254M (+13%); Datacenter, $606M (+105%); Automotive, $132M (+3%); OEM and IP, $180M (+2%).
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP gross margin, 62.1% (+190bps Y/Y); operating expenses, $607M (+22%); cash and equivalents, $7.11B; accounts receivable, $1.27B; cash flow from operating activities, $1.36B; FCF, $942M; capital expenditures, $416M. 
    • Capital return: In FY19, Nvidia intends to return $1.25B to shareholders through dividends and share repurchases. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern Time with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release / CFO presentation 
    • Previously: Nvidia beats by $0.56, beats on revenue (Feb. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 103 Comments
  • MTD

    Mettler Toledo beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Mettler Toledo (NYSE:MTD): Q4 EPS of $5.97 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $778M (+9.6% Y/Y) beats by $13.93M.
    • Shares +3.97%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • FEYE

    FireEye +12.8% after Q4 beats, upside guidance

    • FireEye (NASDAQ:FEYE) shares are up 12.8% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates.
    • Q1 guidance: Revenue, $192M to $197M (consensus: $187.20M); billings, $165M to $175M; EPS, -$0.06 to -$0.03 (consensus: -$0.05); non-GAAP gross margin, approximately 74%; operating margin, approximately -4% to -2%; cash flow from operations, -$10M to $0. 
    • Upside FY18 guidance: Revenue, $815M to $825M (consensus: $800.06M); billings, $810M to $830M; EPS, $0 to $0.04 (consensus: -$0.02); operating margin, 1% to 2%; cash flow from operations, $45M to $55M; capital expenditures, $35M to $40M. 
    • Key metrics: Billings, $242.2M (+9%); cash flow generated by operations, $33.6M (+384%); deferred revenue, $670.7M; non-GAAP gross margin, 75%; operating margin, 1%; cash and equivalents, $180.89M. 
    • Analyst day: Company schedules its 2018 Analyst Day for March 1. 
    • Earnings call is today at 5 PM Eastern Time with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: FireEye beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Feb. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 4 Comments
  • ATVI

    Activision beats with record revenues in Q4, 2017

    • Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI) is up 4.1% after hours following Q4 earnings where it topped expectations on top and bottom lines with record revenues and record full-year operating cash flow.
    • Net bookings for 2017 hit a record $7.16B, up from the prior-year $6.6B, and net bookings from digital channels were a record $5.43B.
    • Overall the company had 385M monthly active users, up from last quarter's 384M: King had 290M MAUs (down 1% Q/Q) along with time spent per player at a record 37 minutes a day. Activision had 55M MAUs (up 12% Q/Q). Blizzard had 40M MAUs.
    • Overall, players spent more than 50 minutes per day in Activision, Blizzard and King games.
    • Revenue breakout: Product sales, $737M (up 5.9%); Subscription, licensing and other revenues, $1.31B (down 0.9%).
    • Revenues by channel: Digital online channels, $1.43B (70% of total); Retail channels, $335M (16% of total); other, $277M (14% of total).
    • Operating cash flow for 2017 hit a record $2.2B.
    • For Q1, it's guiding to $1.82B in non-GAAP revenues along with -$540M impact from GAAP deferrals; EPS of $0.65, with -$0.34 impact from deferrals. Net bookings are expected at $1.28B for Q1 and $7.45B for 2018; consensus expectations for revenue are $1.41B for Q1 and $7.39B for 2018.
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 12 Comments
  • AIZ

    Assurant beats by $0.24, beats on revenue

  • WWD

    Woodward not in talks with Boeing; shares -11% after-hours

    • Woodward (NASDAQ:WWD) -11.6% after-hours after announcing it is not in discussions with Boeing (NYSE:BA) over a possible acquisition of the company.
    • "This rumor is incorrect," WWD says of this morning's WSJ report that Boeing was in talks to buy the company; WWD shares finished today's trade +7.4% due to the story.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 8 Comments
  • NVDA

    Nvidia beats by $0.56, beats on revenue

    • Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA): Q4 EPS of $1.72 beats by $0.56.
    • Revenue of $2.91B (+34.1% Y/Y) beats by $230M.
    • Shares +3.85%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 182 Comments
  • SKX

    International sales soar at Skechers

    • Skechers (NYSE:SKX) reported an unexpected loss in Q4, although the numbers were clouded by a one-time tax expense. Adjusted EPS topped estimates.
    • International sales soared 40% during the quarter, while domestic wholesale sales were up 11.6%.
    • Company-owned global retail sales increased 25.8% Y/Y.
    • Gross margin increased 20 bps to 46.8% of sales, while operating margin improved 200 bps to 5.7%.
    • CEO update: "“The four record sales quarters in 2017 resulted in a new annual sales record of $4.16 billion, an increase of over $600 million from the previous year’s sales. This growth is a testament to the worldwide strength and relevance of our product, marketing and brand."
    • Looking ahead, Skechers expects Q1 sales of $1.175B-$1.2000B vs. $1.23B and EPS of $0.70-$0.75.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 9 Comments

    Skechers beats by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • Skechers (NYSE:SKX): Q4 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $970.59M (+27.0% Y/Y) beats by $89.2M.
    • Shares +5.81%.

    FireEye beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

  • CX

    Cemex -4% following surprise Q4 net loss

    • Cemex (CX -3.9%) slides after reporting a surprise Q4 loss of $105M due to lower operating earnings and higher expenses and taxes, despite a rise in revenues to $3.4B.
    • Analysts had expecting the Mexican cement maker to post a $179M net profit; in the year-ago quarter, CX posted a net profit of $214M.
    • CX says the 4% Y/Y increase in net sales on a like-to-like basis was due to higher prices, in local currency terms in Mexico, the U.S. and Europe, as well as higher volumes in the U.S., Europe and Asia, Middle East & Africa regions.
    • CX says operating EBITDA fell 5% to $625M in the quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla peels off 7% on lack of Model 3 visibility

    • Shares of Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) are down 7.44% to outpace the declines across broad market averages.
    • Yesterday's earnings report and conference call didn't do a whole lot to knock bullish-leaning analysts off their positions, although there is some hedging from the group on when Tesla will outlive its Model 3 production headaches and on the nature of the free cash flow tally generated during the quarter.
    • One analyst taking the long view is Baird's Ben Kallo. "We believe the delayed ramp has derisked the stock, and incremental production data points should drive shares higher as TSLA works towards its 5k/week target," he advises today.
    • Tesla sits just below $320 vs. the 52-week trading range of $242.01 to $389.61.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 303 Comments
  • NYT

    NYT at 10-year high after digital subs growth powers Q4 beat

    • The New York Times Co. (NYSE:NYT) is up 9.2% and tagged a new 10-year high today on Q4 earnings where a sharp increase in subscriptions outweighed ad declines and boosted revenues by double digits.
    • Adjusted EPS grew 30% to $0.39; adjusted operating profit was up to $108.3M due to strong digital subscription revenues (up by $100M), and the impact of a 14th week in the quarter.
    • The company added 99,000 net digital news subs and 157,000 net digital-only subs; News, Cooking, and Crosswords products all contributed to growth.
    • Revenue breakout: Subscription, $269.4M (up 19.2%); Advertising, $182.6M (down 1.3%).
    • For Q1, it's expecting subscription revenues to increase in mid to high single digits Y/Y, and ad revenues to decrease in mid to high single digits. Operating costs are expect to rise in low single digits.
    • For the full year, it sees capex of $60M-$70M.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 8 Comments
  • PTEN

    Patterson-UTI Energy -13% amid uncertainty over deadly accident

    • Patterson-UTI Energy (PTEN -13.3%) plunges after reporting a larger than expected Q4 loss and mounting worries over last month's explosion at an Oklahoma well that killed five workers.
    • In today's earnings conference call, CEO Andy Hendricks said PTEN was still assessing the financial impact from the accident.
    • “While we carry pollution insurance coverage, we are not aware at this time of any meaningful environmental impact from the accident," Hendricks said.
    • For Q4, revenues of $787M more than tripled from $247M in the year-ago quarter, as PTEN says it had term contracts for drilling rigs providing for ~$540M of future dayrate drilling revenue at year-end vs. $470M at the end of Q3.
    • Based on contracts currently in place, PTEN expects an average of 96 rigs operating under term contracts during Q1 and an average of 67 rigs operating under term contracts during FY 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • VIA

    Viacom gains as tax reform boosts earnings

    • Viacom (VIA, VIAB) B shares are up 9.2% despite missing on revenues with Q1 earnings after profits cleared expectations, and many investors looked past the results for clues to a potential re-merger with CBS (or anyone else).
    • While revenues fell nearly 8%, operating income rose 2% to $717M as reported, mainly on lower expenses. Adjusted operating income fell 4%.
    • Net earnings grew 35% principally due to tax reform; adjusted near earnings were flat at $413M.
    • In Media Networks, a drop in affiliate revenues more than erased a 1% gain in ad revenues. Domestic revenues in the division fell 6% while international revenues grew 18%. Meanwhile, Filmed Entertainment was hit by number and mix of current-quarter releases.
    • Revenue by segment: Media Networks, $2.56B (down 1%); Filmed Entertainment, $544M (down 28%).
    • Management said on its earnings call that it's looking at M&A activity as well as other partnerships.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • AAPL

    S&P: Tech sector could "never look the same again" after tax reform harm

    • S&P Global Ratings warns investors that the U.S. tax overhaul could harm the tech sector and that it might “never look the same again.”
    • S&P believes “the overall industry credit profile will weaken over time, largely because of the potential for more aggressive financial policies in response to greater access to overseas cash.” 
    • S&P notes Apple’s (AAPL -0.6%) plans to go from $163B in cash to becoming net-cash neutral and says this could happen with other companies. 
    • Other tech companies with large stashes of overseas cash: Alphabet (GOOGL -2.6%), Cisco (CSCO -2.4%), and Qualcomm (QCOM -3%). 
    • S&P also calls out companies with almost as much debt as overseas cash. If those companies repatriated and passed the cash on to shareholders while holding on to the debt, the action would prove harmful to the company’s rating. 
    • Companies with overseas cash and debt nearly in balance:  Oracle (ORCL -2.7%), Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE -1.9%), Western Digital (WDC -3%), and Intel (INTC -3.9%).  
    • Previously: Moody's not too concerned with Apple's "cash neutral" policy (Feb. 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 127 Comments
  • INFN

    Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (2/8/18)

    • Gainers: INFN +29%. GRUB +28%. TWTR +15%. USAT +13%. VRTU +11%.
    • Losers: QTM-OLD -38%. MRAM -21%. COHR -18%. ICHR -17%. INPX -17%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 6 Comments
  • EPM

    Evolution Petroleum upgraded to Buy at Euro Pacific following earnings

    • Evolution Petroleum (EPM +6%) is higher as Euro Pacific Capital upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with a $10 price target following FQ2 earnings,
    • With very low capital requirements, a sizable working capital surplus and flattish production, Euro Pacific believes EPM will be able to sustain the current dividend level for some time, should commodity prices hold up.
    • The firm also thinks the recent tax law changes, which cut the federal corporate income tax rate to 21%, should reduce EPM's payable tax burden over time.
    • Source: Briefing.com
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • PLUG

    Plug Power -8% after issuing downside guidance

    • Plug Power (PLUG -8.3%) plunges after a business update reveals disappointing guidance for Q1 and FY 2018 revenues.
    • For Q1, Plug sees Q1 revenues of $22M-$24M, well below analyst consensus expectations for $38.3M, and an adjusted EBITDA loss of $11M-$13M vs. a $15M loss in the year-ago quarter.
    • For the full year, the company forecasts revenues of $155M-$180M vs. $214M consensus.
    • Plug also says 2017 gross margins were affected by customer programs that were pushed into 2018, and bookings for the year came in just short of the company's goal.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 41 Comments
  • UEPS

    Net1 acquires additional 5% in Bank Frick

    • Net 1 UEPS Technologies (NASDAQ:UEPS) has entered into an agreement to acquire a 5% additional interest in Bank Frick & Co. AG, a fully licensed bank based in Balzers, Liechtenstein.
    • Following the successful completion of this investment, the Company will own 35% of Bank Frick.
    • The Company has an option, exercisable until Oct. 2, 2019, to acquire an additional 35% interest in Bank Frick.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • GT

    Goodyear Tire & Rubber lower after setting 2020 operating income target

    • Goodyear Tire & Rubber (GT -6.9%) is down more than broad market averages after the company dramatically reduces its 2020 segment operating income forecast to $2B-$2.4B, from a longstanding prior outlook of $3B.
    • The company also set a long-term capital allocation plan that includes growth capital, restructuring, debt/pension payments and a shareholder return program.
    • Previously: Goodyear Tire & Rubber beats by $0.23, beats on revenue (Feb. 8)
    • Previously: Goodyear Tire & Rubber higher on earnings beat (Feb. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • WSO

    Watsco Boosts annual dividend 16%

    • Watsco (NYSE:WSO) Board has approved a 16% increase in its annual dividend to $5.80/share beginning in April 2018.
    • Albert H. Nahmad, Watsco’s Chairman & CEO stated: “We are pleased to be able to increase dividends to our shareholders and reflects our confidence in the business and is supported by our continued positive cash flow and strong balance sheet.”
    • Press Release

    Baird buys the dip in Canada Goose

  • COR

    CoreSite Realty lower 4.9% after reporting 4Q result

    • CoreSite Realty lower (COR -4.9%) despite FFO of $1.18 beats estimate by $0.04.
    • The company expects FY18 FFO in the range of $4.92 - $5.04 against the consensus of $5.00,
    • The two new revenue recognition and lease accounting standards are cumulatively expected to reduce FFO by ~$0.06/share.
    • Conference Call

    | 1:17 PM
  • FDS

    FactSet enters strategic deal with CG Blockchain

    • FactSet (FDS -1.6%) has entered a strategic relationship with CG Blockchain to offer clients the latter's products through its BCT Fundstore.
    • CG Blockchain clients will in turn use FactSet's Portware execution and order management capabilities.
    • BCT Fundstore offers a suite of blockchain apps as an extension of CG Blockchain's product ComplianceGuard.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • MTCH

    Barclays raises its Match Group price target after earnings

    • Barclays raises its Match Group (NASDAQ:MTCH) price target from $30 to $37, a nearly 3% upside on yesterday’s close.
    • Firm says the key to the bull case is unlocking additional value at Tinder while improving the other top trends. Tinder now a tailwind to ARPU and EBITDA margins instead of a headwind due to continued successes of Tinder Gold. 
    • Firm notes that Match.com and OKCupid subs returned to positive year-over-year growth and that impacts from the Affinity wind down is shrinking.
    • Match currently trades at 18x FY19 EBITDA, which Barclay calls appropriate with the 13% Y/Y growth outlook. But 2H could have upside with new product releases at Tinder. 
    • Source: Briefing.com. 
    • Match Group shares are down 5.9% to $33.92.  
    • Previously: Match Group reports Q4 beat, upside Q1 guidance (Feb. 6)
    • Previously: Match earnings call: Plans for 2H deceleration, mentions tech patent (Feb. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 4 Comments
  • VIRT

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (02/08/2018)

    • Gainers: VIRT +27%. GYRO +5%.SGLB +5%.
    • Losers: MN -14%. BBDO -9%. OCSL -7%. LMFA -7%. PZN -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • RGLD

    Royal Gold +3% as Mt. Milligan operations seen fully resuming in April

    • Royal Gold (RGLD +2.9%) is higher despite reporting in-line FQ2 results, as Mt. Milligan operator Centerra Gold (OTCPK:CAGDF +3.9%) says it expects milling operations to return to full capacity in April.
    • RGLD reports Q4 production of 89.7K gold equiv. oz., up 2% Y/Y, while the average realized gold price of $1,275 rose 4% and operating cash flow of $76M was an 8% increase.
    • RGLD expects the U.S. tax law changes will have a positive long-term impact on future financial results through the reduction in the corporate tax rate and allowing the repatriation of foreign earnings.
    • Analysts at Canaccord Genuity cite the Mt. Milligan news as well as valuation in upgrading RGLD to Buy from Hold with a $102 price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • FOX

    Hulu losses deepen as content investments rise

    • Amid heavy investments on original content, Hulu lost $920M last year, according to a Comcast 10-K.
    • The service -- co-owned by Comcast (CMCSA -3.2%), Disney (DIS -1.8%), Fox (FOX -2.1%, FOXA -2%) and Time Warner (TWX -1.5%) -- had lost $531M the year prior.
    • Owners invested $1B, up from the prior-year $733M, including $583M from new partner Time Warner.
    • Investments (and content costs) are expected to climb further in the coming year, as amid a transformation in the ownership (Disney's deal for Fox media assets means it will add Fox's 30% stake to its own, to hold 60%).
    • As of year-end, Hulu said it had more than 17M subs for its on-demand and live packages.
    • Comcast 10-K

  • TYME

    Tyme's lead candidate SM-88 shows treatment effect in mid-stage prostate cancer study; shares ahead 4%

    • Preliminary results from an ongoing Phase 2 clinical trial assessing Tyme Technologies' (TYME +3.8%) lead candidate SM-88 in patients with non-metastatic, biochemical-recurrent prostate cancer showed a positive effect. The data are being presented at the ASCO GU Symposium in San Francisco.
    • 92% (n=12/13) of evaluable patients maintained radiographic progression-free survival (rPFS) for a median of 12 months since biochemical recurrence and 10 months since starting SM-88 treatment. All 12 who have maintained rPFS have also shown significant reductions in circulating tumor cells.
    • 85% (n=11/13) experienced stable or rising testosterone levels with no serious (Grade 3) or life-threatening (Grade 4) adverse events.
    • On the quality-of-life front, 100% (n=13/13) of patients reported stable/improved interest in sex, 62% reported no or resolved hot flashes and 54% rated their overall health as "excellent."
    • A Phase 2 study in pancreatic cancer will start soon.
    • SM-88 is a combination therapy that uses a proprietary dysfunctional tyrosine derivative to interrupt the metabolic processes of cancer cells, breaking down their defenses and making them vulnerable to oxidative stress and death.
    • Previously: Tyme Tech's lead candidate shows positive effect in early-stage pancreatic cancer study; shares ahead 2% (Jan. 19)

  • ADMS

    Study data show that Parkinson's patients could switch to Adamas Pharma's Gocovri without interruption; shares up 3%

    • A subgroup analysis of Parkinson's disease (PD) patients enrolled in the ongoing open-label EASE LID 2 study who were still experiencing uncontrolled involuntary movement showed improvements after switching to Adamas Pharmaceuticals' (ADMS +2.5%) GOCOVRI (amantadine) extended-release capsules from an immediate-release formulation.
    • Specifically, 32 PD patients who were receiving the immediate release version, amantadine hydrochloride (Endo Pharmaceutical's (ENDP -0.5%) SYMMETREL), experienced a 35% improvement in motor complications eight weeks after switching to GOCOVRI with no worsening of adverse events. The effects were maintained throughout the 64-week assessment period.
    • Stuart Isaacson, MD, Director of the Clinical Research Center at the Parkinson’s Disease and Movement Disorders Center of Boca Raton says, “These data suggest that patients currently being treated with amantadine IR could be switched directly to GOCOVRI without interruption. The results of this subgroup analysis, while open-label, continue to support the benefits of GOCOVRI in the treatment of Parkinson’s disease patients with dyskinesia and OFF.”
    • Topline data from EASE LID 2 will be reported next quarter.
    • Previously: FDA OKs Adamas Pharma's amantadine for PD-related dyskinesia; shares up 35% after hours (Aug. 24, 2017)

    Synchronoss +6.4% on Nasdaq compliance extension

    • Synchronoss Tech (NASDAQ:SNCR) receives a positive Nasdaq Hearings Panel decision granting the company an extension to regain compliance with listing requirements.
